title: TreyARC
author: TreyARC
content: Is there anyway to use mobile graphic cards (laptop) in a desktop? Or there is any kind of modification around this? I have a mobile GPU that's working perfectly but the Laptop I removed the GPU from is dead.

comments.author: StonieMalony
comments.body: Im bit confused ... I havent seen laptops that have internal removable gpus ... but maybe I havent seen enough

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: TreyARC on May 26, 2022, 07:56:30 AMIs there anyway to use mobile graphic cards (laptop) in a desktop? Or there is any kind of modification around this? I have a mobile GPU that's working perfectly but the Laptop I removed the GPU from is dead. There are no mobile graphics cards for modern laptops. The video chip is installed on the laptop motherboard.I've seen PC graphics cards from China that used a video chip from a broken laptop.This was relevant before the hacking of the LHR algorithm. You can sell your video chip, but you can't make a video card out of it at home.

comments.author: MidNite36
comments.body: Some laptops GPU are removable, below is the picture of a Nvidia Tesla M6 Gddr5 GPU that was removed from a laptop.OP what you are seeking for is possible using the adapter below but you will face lot of headache, how do you tend to cool the GPU and it's mem chips?

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: MidNite36 on May 27, 2022, 03:37:02 PMSome laptops GPU are removable, below is the picture of a Nvidia Tesla M6 Gddr5 GPU that was removed from a laptop.Can you show me the laptop in which this video card is installed?https://www.ebay.com/itm/HP-Nvidia-Tesla-M6-MXM-Mobile-Server-GPU-Accelerator-8GB-806127-001-808409-001-/302287972800I think that this video card is used for mobile servers, and it is cheaper to integrate a video chip into a laptop.

comments.author: Kalchef
comments.body: Quote from: FP91G on May 27, 2022, 03:45:36 PMQuote from: MidNite36 on May 27, 2022, 03:37:02 PMSome laptops GPU are removable, below is the picture of a Nvidia Tesla M6 Gddr5 GPU that was removed from a laptop.Can you show me the laptop in which this video card is installed?https://www.ebay.com/itm/HP-Nvidia-Tesla-M6-MXM-Mobile-Server-GPU-Accelerator-8GB-806127-001-808409-001-/302287972800I think that this video card is used for mobile servers, and it is cheaper to integrate a video chip into a laptop.I have a gtx1050 that's also removable, the thing is some laptops have integrated GPU on the motherboard and some are actually removable like You dont believe or what? Find a dell Alienware you should be able to remove its GPU, this is another proof A Dell Alienware GPU GTX980M for sell on Aliexpress

comments.author: Wincob
comments.body: Quote from: Kalchef on May 27, 2022, 04:09:05 PMQuote from: FP91G on May 27, 2022, 03:45:36 PMQuote from: MidNite36 on May 27, 2022, 03:37:02 PMSome laptops GPU are removable, below is the picture of a Nvidia Tesla M6 Gddr5 GPU that was removed from a laptop.Can you show me the laptop in which this video card is installed?https://www.ebay.com/itm/HP-Nvidia-Tesla-M6-MXM-Mobile-Server-GPU-Accelerator-8GB-806127-001-808409-001-/302287972800I think that this video card is used for mobile servers, and it is cheaper to integrate a video chip into a laptop.I have a gtx1050 that's also removable, the thing is some laptops have integrated GPU on the motherboard and some are actually removable like You dont believe or what? Find a dell Alienware you should be able to remove its GPU, this is another proof A Dell Alienware GPU GTX980M for sell on AliexpressOld mobile GPUs of cos, you can't find RTX 20series GPU with such mouth pins today.

comments.author: batsonxl
comments.body: here china still selling them as mining cards¬† https://videocardz.com/newz/chinese-oems-are-still-selling-geforce-rtx-30-laptop-gpus-as-desktop-mining-cards-to-avoid-lhr-restrictions

comments.author: Kalchef
comments.body: Quote from: batsonxl on May 27, 2022, 08:53:25 PMhere china still selling them as mining cards¬† https://videocardz.com/newz/chinese-oems-are-still-selling-geforce-rtx-30-laptop-gpus-as-desktop-mining-cards-to-avoid-lhr-restrictionsSaw this on news as well, I am wondering how they come up with this idea, how did they work the mobile gpu into a standard gpu with fully functioning cooling fans? And those GPU brands are even nameless.

And those GPU brands are even nameless.You know what happens in China. Or there is any kind of modification around this? I have a mobile GPU that's working perfectly but the Laptop I removed the GPU from is dead. This might be a little challenge, especially now that some graphics cards are LHR.

comments.author: TreyARC
comments.body: I got rid of this idea because the mobile gpu is faulty but I came across a modification that let you use desktop gpu on a laptop, it's available at a store in China I'm not just sure if it's going to be worth it or not. Thanks for the contributions guys üëç.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: TreyARC on August 11, 2022, 10:04:30 AMI got rid of this idea because the mobile gpu is faulty but I came across a modification that let you use desktop gpu on a laptop, it's available at a store in China I'm not just sure if it's going to be worth it or not. Thanks for the contributions guys üëç. Mining on laptops has long since died. Some miners still use laptops, but these are old purchases.An external GPU costs more than a regular PC GPU. If you really want to mine now, then buy a small mining farm in an open case.

comments.author: adaseb
comments.body: Quote from: TreyARC on August 11, 2022, 10:04:30 AMI got rid of this idea because the mobile gpu is faulty but I came across a modification that let you use desktop gpu on a laptop, it's available at a store in China I'm not just sure if it's going to be worth it or not. Thanks for the contributions guys üëç. Yes this is actually possible and this device was created maybe like 10 years ago however nobody bought it because it would be a hassle to have to carry the device along with the GPU around with a laptop. You might as well get a PC in this case.Then gaming laptops came out and this device had even less of a market. It also wasn‚Äôt cheap and you can only attach one GPU.

comments.author: MetaMii
comments.body: Quote from: TreyARC on August 11, 2022, 10:04:30 AMI got rid of this idea because the mobile gpu is faulty but I came across a modification that let you use desktop gpu on a laptop, it's available at a store in China I'm not just sure if it's going to be worth it or not. Thanks for the contributions guys üëç. There is two version of this available in the market right now, one is egpu with thunderbolt 3 compatible, the laptop must be thinderbolt 3 compatible as well, the other is modification of desktop GPU with its own PSU and a connector going to the laptop.But using these makes a laptop not a laptop anymore, you cant carry this around so it doesn't make sense to me, better off with a monitor and gpu in a motherboard/desktop PC.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: MetaMii on August 12, 2022, 08:38:30 AMQuote from: TreyARC on August 11, 2022, 10:04:30 AMI got rid of this idea because the mobile gpu is faulty but I came across a modification that let you use desktop gpu on a laptop, it's available at a store in China I'm not just sure if it's going to be worth it or not. Thanks for the contributions guys üëç. There is two version of this available in the market right now, one is egpu with thunderbolt 3 compatible, the laptop must be thinderbolt 3 compatible as well, the other is modification of desktop GPU with its own PSU and a connector going to the laptop.But using these makes a laptop not a laptop anymore, you cant carry this around so it doesn't make sense to me, better off with a monitor and gpu in a motherboard/desktop PC.Show me a model that does not use the thunderbolt interface. I looked at external video cards for a laptop and did not find models with a different interface. I have found docking stations for $300 and more, but you still need to buy a compatible video card or its ready-made solutions with video cards. But building a PC is cheaper.

comments.author: Widdop37
comments.body: Quote from: FP91G on August 12, 2022, 11:52:26 AMQuote from: MetaMii on August 12, 2022, 08:38:30 AMQuote from: TreyARC on August 11, 2022, 10:04:30 AMI got rid of this idea because the mobile gpu is faulty but I came across a modification that let you use desktop gpu on a laptop, it's available at a store in China I'm not just sure if it's going to be worth it or not. There is two version of this available in the market right now, one is egpu with thunderbolt 3 compatible, the laptop must be thinderbolt 3 compatible as well, the other is modification of desktop GPU with its own PSU and a connector going to the laptop.But using these makes a laptop not a laptop anymore, you cant carry this around so it doesn't make sense to me, better off with a monitor and gpu in a motherboard/desktop PC.Show me a model that does not use the thunderbolt interface. I looked at external video cards for a laptop and did not find models with a different interface. I have found docking stations for $300 and more, but you still need to buy a compatible video card or its ready-made solutions with video cards. But building a PC is cheaper.Yeah there are components that make desktop GPU work on a laptop using the m2 slot at the back of the laptop. You aren't looking enough that's why you dont see any.
